title: Globalization and the Modern World Economy

vocab.definition: Economic philosophy emphasizing free markets and minimal government intervention
Economic principle that countries should specialize in what they produce most efficiently
Network of organizations involved in producing and delivering goods
Changes in exchange rates between different national currencies
A nation's control over its own economic policies and decisions

teachingNotes: Evaluate complex economic theories and their real-world applications. Analyze critiques of globalization and alternative models.

sample.question: What economic philosophy emphasizes free markets and minimal government intervention?

truefalse.question: Comparative advantage suggests countries should produce everything they need domestically.

multiplechoice.question: What connects all organizations involved in producing and delivering goods?

shortanswer.question: What are criticisms of economic globalization?
